page.title: 12HOUSING IN THORNER (2)
page.content:
Very few of the houses on Main Street have a front garden, but have extensive rear gardens.
Houses are both rented and privately owned. Prices of privately owned properties (in the year 1985) varied between Â£29000 for a small 3 bedroomed terraced house, to semi-detached houses of around Â£40000 and an 'individual' stone detached house for Â£67000.
Thorner seems to have become an executive dormitory suburb of Leeds, and so house prices are higher than in the surrounding area, and reflect supply and demand.
